intro: Zaleya galericulata subsp. galericulata, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in dense spikes. Zaleya galericulata subsp. galericulata is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other showy and sometimes toxic plants.
